task.title: Starting the Engine in Cold Weather
task.shortdesc: Specialized procedure for starting an engine when temperatures are low and gasoline vaporization is difficult.

prereq.p: Ensure the vehicle is in a well-ventilated area with the parking brake engaged.

step.stepxmp: Turn one-quarter turn to the left to allow a richer gasoline mixture

substep.cmd: Turn the crank six to eight one-quarter turns in quick succession
substep.stepxmp: Alternatively, use the starter to turn the motor over a few times

substep.cmd: Place spark lever in approximately third notch

step.stepxmp: Give crank one or two turns or close the starting switch

substep.cmd: Advance spark eight or ten notches on the quadrant
Let the motor run until thoroughly heated

step.stepxmp: Turn carburetor adjustment back one-quarter turn after engine is warmed up

result.p: The engine should now be running smoothly. Avoid immediate driving until the engine is fully warmed.

note.p: Avoid stopping the engine by pulling out the priming rod unless the car will stand overnight or long enough to cool off.
